intro: Elytranthe, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Elytranthe species are typically herbaceous and can be found in a variety of habitats, including wetlands and disturbed soils. They are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
